test_questions.question: How long is an IPv6 address?
test_questions.explanation: An IPv6 address is 128 bits long.

test_questions.question: What flavor of Network Address Translation can be used to have one IP address allow many users to connect to the global Internet?
test_questions.explanation: Port Address Translation (PAT) allows a one-to-many approach to network address translation.

test_questions.question:
What are the two main types of access control lists (ACLs)?
  Standard
  IEEE
  Extended
  Specialized
test_questions.explanation: Standard and extended access control lists (ACLs) are used to configure security on a router.

test_questions.question: What command is used to create a backup configuration?
test_questions.explanation: The command to back up the configuration on a router is copy running-config startup-config.

test_questions.question:
You have 10 users plugged into a hub running 10Mbps half-duplex. There is a server connected to the switch running 10Mbps half-duplex as well. How much bandwidth does each 
host have to the server?
test_questions.explanation: Each device has 10 Mbps	to the server.

test_questions.question: Which WLAN IEEE specification allows up to 54Mbps at 2.4GHz?
test_questions.explanation: IEEE 802.11B is 2.4GHz, but with a maximum of only 11Mbps. IEEE 802.11G is in the 2.4GHz range, with a top speed of 54Mbps.

test_questions.question: Which of the following is the valid host range for the subnet on which the IP address 192.168.168.188 255.255.255.192 resides?
test_questions.explanation:
256 - 192 = 64. 64 + 64 = 128. 128 + 64 = 192. The subnet is 128, the broadcast address 
is 191, and the valid host range is the numbers in between, or 129-190.

test_questions.question: To back up an IOS, what command will you use?
test_questions.explanation: The command copy flash tftp will prompt you to back up an existing IOS in flash to a TFTP host.

test_questions.question: What protocol does PPP use to identify the Network layer protocol?
test_questions.explanation: Network Control Protocol is used to help identify the Network layer protocol used in the packet.

test_questions.question: Which of the following commands will allow you to set your Telnet password on a Cisco router?
test_questions.explanation: The command line vty 0 4 places you in a prompt that will allow you to set or change your Telnet password.

test_questions.question: Which protocol does DHCP use at the Transport layer?
test_questions.explanation: User Datagram Protocol is a connection network service at the Transport layer, and DHCP uses this connectionless service.

test_questions.question: Which command is used to determine if an IP access list is enabled on a particular interface?
test_questions.explanation: The show ip interface command will show you if any outbound or inbound interfaces have an access list set.

test_questions.question: Where is a hub specified in the OSI model?
test_questions.explanation: Hubs regenerate electrical signals, which are specified at the Physical layer.

test_questions.question: What does the passive command provide to dynamic routing protocols?
test_questions.opta: Stops an interface from sending or receiving periodic dynamic updates.
test_questions.optb: Stops an interface from sending periodic dynamic updates but not from receiving updates.
test_questions.optc: Stops the router from receiving any dynamic updates.
test_questions.optd: Stops the router from sending any dynamic updates.
test_questions.explanation: The passive command, short for passive-interface, stops regular updates from being sent out an interface. However, the interface can still receive updates.

test_questions.question: Which protocol is used to send a destination network unknown message back to originating hosts?
test_questions.explanation: ICMP is the protocol at the Network layer that is used to send messages back to an originating router.

test_questions.question: How often are BPDUs sent from a layer 2 device?
test_questions.explanation: Every 2 seconds, BPDUs are sent out from all active bridge ports by default.

test_questions.question: How many broadcast domains are created when you segment a network with a 12-port switch?
test_questions.explanation: By default, switches break up collision domains but are one large broadcast domain.

test_questions.question: What does the command routerA(config)#line cons 0 allow you to perform next?
test_questions.explanation: The command line console 0 places you at a prompt where you can then set your console user-mode password.

test_questions.question: Which router command allows you to view the entire contents of all access lists?
test_questions.explanation: To see the contents of all access lists, use the show access-lists command.

test_questions.question: Which class of IP address has the most host addresses available by default?
test_questions.explanation: Class A addressing provides 24 bits for host addressing.

test_questions.question: In a network with dozens of switches, how many root bridges would you have?
test_questions.explanation: You should have only one root bridge per network.

test_questions.question: What PPP protocol provides dynamic addressing, authentication, and multilink?
test_questions.explanation: Link Control Protocol in the PPP stack provides dynamic addressing, authentication, and multilink.

test_questions.question: What is a stub network?
test_questions.opta: A network with more than one exit point.
test_questions.optb: A network with more than one exit and entry point.
test_questions.optc: A network with only one entry and no exit point.
test_questions.optd: A network that has only one entry and exit point.
test_questions.explanation: Stub networks have only one connection to an internetwork. Only default routes can be set on a stub network or network loops may occur.

test_questions.question: If your router is facilitating a CSU/DSU, which of the following commands do you need to use to provide the router with a 64000bps serial link?
test_questions.explanation: The clock rate command is two words, and the speed of the line is in bps.

test_questions.question: Which one of the following is true regarding VLANs?
test_questions.opta: Two VLANs are configured by default on all Cisco switches.
test_questions.optb: VLANs only work if you have a complete Cisco switched internetwork. No off-brand switches are allowed.
test_questions.optc: You should not have more than 10 switches in the same VTP domain.
test_questions.optd: VTP is used to send VLAN information to switches in a configured VTP domain.
test_questions.explanation: Switches do not propagate VLAN information by default; you must configure the VTP domain. VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) is used to propagate VLAN information across a trunk link.

test_questions.question: What does a VLAN do?
test_questions.opta: Acts as the fastest port to all servers.
test_questions.optb: Provides multiple collision domains on one switch port.
test_questions.optc: Breaks up broadcast domains in a layer 2 switch internetwork.
test_questions.optd: Provides multiple broadcast domains within a single collision domain.
test_questions.explanation: VLANs break up broadcast domains at layer 2.

test_questions.question: What is the main reason the OSI model was created?
test_questions.opta: To create a layered model larger than the DoD model.
test_questions.optb: So application developers can change only one layer's protocols at a time.
test_questions.optd: So Cisco could use the model.
test_questions.explanation: The primary reason the OSI model was created was so that different networks could inter-operate.

test_questions.question: How many collision domains are created when you segment a network with a 12-port switch?
test_questions.explanation: Layer 2 switching creates individual collision domains.

test_questions.question: What command will display the line, protocol, DLCI, and LMI information of an interface?
test_questions.explanation: The show interface command shows the line, protocol, DLCI, and LMI information of an interface.

test_questions.question: Which protocol does Ping use?
test_questions.explanation: ICMP is the protocol at the Network layer that is used to send echo requests and replies.

test_questions.question: Which command is used to upgrade an IOS on a Cisco router?
test_questions.explanation: The copy tftp flash command places a new file in flash memory, which is the default location for the Cisco IOS in Cisco routers.

test_questions.question: If you wanted to delete the configuration stored in NVRAM, what would you type?
test_questions.explanation: The command erase startup-config deletes the configuration stored in NVRAM.

test_questions.question:
What protocols are used to configure trunking on a switch?
  VLAN Trunking Protocol
  VLAN
  802.1Q
  ISL
test_questions.explanation: VTP is not right because it has nothing to do with trunking except that it sends VLAN information across a trunk link. 802.1Q and ISL are used to configure trunking on a port.
